Projects.title: Cambiar
desc: I developed the Hertz Mexico website (https://www.hertzmexico.com/en/), delivering a modern, user-friendly platform for car rentals across Mexico.

The front-end was built using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, with a mobile-first approach to ensure a seamless experience across devices. I integrated a content management system, likely WordPress or a headless CMS, to streamline content updates and manage bookings effectively. Advanced SEO practices, performance optimization, and analytics tools were incorporated to enhance visibility and user engagement.
This project showcases my ability to merge aesthetic design with robust technical architecture to deliver a feature-rich web experience for both visitors and administrators.

Projects.title: Car Rental
desc: I developed rentalpreveza.gr, a comprehensive rental platform that showcases properties in the Preveza region with a focus on both aesthetic appeal and user functionality.

Using modern web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, WordPress and JavaScript alongside a robust front-end framework like React, I crafted a responsive and intuitive interface that adapts seamlessly to various devices. The platform features dynamic property listings, integrated booking forms, and real-time availability checks, enhancing the overall user experience. On the back-end, I employed technologies like Node.js and a scalable database solution to ensure efficient data management, while integrating APIs like Google Maps to provide enriched location-based services.
This project allowed me to fully leverage my expertise in responsive design, performance optimization, and the integration of diverse web services to deliver a robust and engaging web experience.

Projects.title: House Rental
desc: I developed crescentretreats.com, a modern and engaging website dedicated to promoting wellness retreats and exceptional guest experiences.

The front-end was built using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, potentially enhanced with React for dynamic content rendering and a mobile-first responsive design that delivers a seamless experience across devices. On the back-end, I integrated a content management system—potentially WordPress or a headless CMS—to streamline content updates and manage bookings or inquiries effectively. Advanced SEO practices, performance optimization, and analytics tools were incorporated to ensure high visibility and a data-driven approach to enhancing user engagement.
This project showcases my ability to merge aesthetic design with robust technical architecture to deliver a feature-rich web experience for both visitors and administrators.

Projects.title: Ibiza
desc: I developed the Loux Ibiza website (https://www.louxibiza.com/), a visually stunning platform tailored for luxury lifestyle management services in Ibiza.

The front-end was built using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, with a mobile-first approach to ensure a seamless experience across devices. I integrated a content management system, likely WordPress or a headless CMS, to streamline content updates and manage bookings effectively. Advanced SEO practices, performance optimization, and analytics tools were incorporated to enhance visibility and user engagement.
This project showcases my ability to merge aesthetic design with robust technical architecture to deliver a feature-rich web experience for both visitors and administrators.

Projects.title: Lichi
desc: I developed lichi.com/us/en, a modern, visually engaging platform that effectively represents the brand's innovative solutions.

The site features a responsive front-end built with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript—leveraging frameworks like React or Next.js to deliver a seamless and dynamic user experience. On the back-end, robust APIs, serverless functions, and a headless CMS facilitate efficient content management and rapid data processing

Additionally, I integrated advanced SEO strategies, performance optimizations, and analytics tools to ensure maximum visibility and user engagement, highlighting my expertise in full-stack, modern web development.

Projects.title: Fashion Lilysilk
desc: I developed LILYSILK's global e-commerce platform, creating a visually appealing and highly functional online store for luxury silk products

The front-end was built using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and React for dynamic content rendering, ensuring a responsive, mobile-first design. For the back-end, I integrated a headless CMS to streamline product management and enhance flexibility. I also implemented SEO best practices, performance optimizations, and robust analytics tools to drive traffic and user engagement.
This project highlights my expertise in building scalable, performance-optimized websites with seamless user experiences.

Projects.title: My House
desc: I developed myhousehospitality.com, a modern hospitality platform designed to deliver an engaging and user-friendly experience for visitors and potential clients.

The site leverages a responsive front-end built with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, incorporating a framework like React to ensure smooth performance and a mobile-first design. On the server side, a robust Node.js and Express setup manages API integrations and dynamic content delivery, while a scalable database such as MongoDB underpins the efficient handling of user inquiries and booking data.
Additionally, I employed advanced SEO optimization and performance tuning to create a fast, search-friendly website that aligns with contemporary web standards and best practices.

Projects.title: Only One
desc: I developed onestayinfo.holidayfuture.com, a comprehensive online platform dedicated to holiday stay information and bookings.

The project leverages a modern front-end stack with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript—utilizing frameworks such as React for dynamic content rendering and a modular UI that ensures a seamless user experience across devices. On the back-end, the application is powered by Node.js coupled with Express, providing robust RESTful APIs that handle data interactions and integrate with various external services. A NoSQL database solution, like MongoDB, has been incorporated to efficiently manage listings and user data while maintaining scalability and performance.
Additionally, advanced techniques in SEO optimization, responsive design, and secure API integrations were employed to create an engaging, high-performing platform for users.

Projects.title: Re-evolution
desc: I developed hispanosuizacars.com, a dynamic and responsive website for a premium car dealership that effectively showcases their extensive inventory and services. Leveraging modern technologies such as WordPress, HTML5, CSS3, PHP and JavaScript,

I created an engaging user interface that adapts seamlessly across devices. I implemented interactive elements including dynamic inventory displays, integrated contact forms, and lead capture mechanisms to enhance user engagement and conversion rates. On the back-end, I utilized Node.js and a reliable database system to manage inventory data efficiently while ensuring secure, fast, and scalable interactions through API integrations.
This project allowed me to combine creative design with technical precision, optimizing performance and responsiveness for a superior online car shopping experience.

Projects.title: Rental Dream
desc: I developed rent-qoute-pro.vercel.app, a streamlined web application for generating rental quotes with an emphasis on speed and user engagement.

Built with Next.js and deployed on Vercel, the site leverages server-side rendering and API routes for fast, dynamic content delivery. The powerful React front-end ensures a smooth and responsive user interface, enhanced by modern styling frameworks like Tailwind CSS. Serverless functions handle data processing and integration with external services, offering scalability and efficient performance.
This project highlights my expertise in advanced JavaScript frameworks, serverless architecture, and performance-focused web development.

Projects.title: Sea Sensational
desc: I developed sensationalseaadventures.com, a dynamic website that captures the adventurous spirit of marine tours and excursions.

I utilized modern web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript alongside frameworks like React to create a responsive and engaging user interface. The integration of booking systems and contact forms streamlined user interactions, showcasing my expertise in API integrations and back-end technologies.

Additional skills in performance optimization, SEO best practices, and mobile-first design played a critical role in ensuring a robust and high-traffic site. This project was a perfect blend of creative design and technical precision, reflecting the vibrant energy of the brand.

Projects.title: Mind Mirror
desc: LMS website that integrated Generative AI feauture to track studnet various keys like mood, behavior, and cognitive ability when learning. The website is built using Laravel as a fullstack framework. In this website teacher can track student mood and other metrics data based on the material students accessed.

The website also has a few features such as a dashboard for the teacher to see the student's data, a material page, and a quiz page. The website also has a few charts to visualize the student's data. The website provided the student captured data that can be downloaded by the teacher.
The website also has a features to export the lecture data such as the mood, behaviour, and cognitive score to a xlxs file that can be downloaded by the teacher.

Projects.title: Javanese Translation Website
desc: A Javanese ngoko - krama translation website that I created as a collaborative project with my friends. The website is built using the original Transformer architecture by Vaswani et al. (2017). Built with Python, TensorFlow, Flask, HTML, and CSS, the website allows users to input text in Javanese krama and receive the corresponding ngoko translation.

The website is designed to be simple to use, with a clean and modern interface that appeals to a wide audience. Users can input text in Javanese krama and receive the corresponding ngoko translation. The Project also provide ipynb file for the model training and the model itself.

Projects.title: SIPETI: Heart Prediction Website
desc: This is a Machine Learning based website that I created as a collage project. The website is built using Decision Tree algorithm and Flask. The website is a heart attack prediction website that can predict whether a person will get a heart attack or not based on their health condition.

In this website user can predict, customize dataset, customize model, and see the model performance. The website also has a few features such as a dashboard for the user to see the model performance, and a few charts to visualize the decision tree model.

Projects.title: Generative Trivia
desc: A generative trivia website built with Next.js, Firebase, NextAuth, Google OAuth, and TypeScript. Users can generate trivia questions for predefined school subjects and answer them with a unique interactive input style. The application supports user authentication with Google and stores data in Firestore.

The project is a culmination of my passion for web development and my desire to create a fun and interactive learning platform. The website is designed to be user-friendly and engaging, with a clean and modern interface that appeals to a wide audience. The trivia questions are generated using the Gemini API, which provides a diverse range of questions for users to answer.

Projects.title: Saku Senyum
desc: Saku Senyum is a website that I created as a Fullstack Developer in PT Hafdzahmedia based on client request. The website is a sales management for UMKM or small business. The website is built using Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, ShadCN UI, Prisma, and MySQL.

The website has a few features such as a dashboard for the user to manage their business sales, a statistic page, and a sales report page. User can see their sales performance in a fancy chart to make it easier to understand. The user also can export their sales report to a PDF file which can be printed or saved to their device.

Projects.title: Simadun
desc: Simadun is an Exam Management System developed for doctoral students in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Informatics Universitas Negeri Malang. The system facilitates the management of five different types of examinations, allowing students to apply for exams with ease. Professors and program heads can efficiently oversee the exam processes.

With Simadun, students can submit their exam applications online, track their application status, and receive timely notifications regarding their exam schedules. Program heads and relevant lecturers have access to comprehensive dashboards where they can manage exam requests, allocate resources, and monitor overall exam logistics.

Projects.title: LUDOang
desc: LUDOang is a game that my team and I created for a final project in my university. The game is built python, pygame, and OpenGL. The game is a 2D game that is inspired by a Ludo game. The game has a few features such randomZone, and a 3D dice.

RandomZone is a feature that allows the player to get a random number of steps. The 3D dice is a feature that allows the player to roll a 3D dice. The game also has a few other features menuy screen and also loading screen.
Beside that the game also has a audio theme that will play when the game is started. The game also has a few sound effects such as dice roll sound, and a sound when the player win the game.

Projects.title: VICC Landing Page
desc: This project is one of my freelance projects. This project is a landing page for Vocational Inter-cultural Camp event held by Vocational Faculty of Universitas Negeri Malang. The website is built using Next.js, Javascript, and Tailwind CSS.

The website is mainly frontend project, which is already using responsive design. The website has a few features such carousel, and a few animations. The website also has a few pages such as home, topic, and speaker page.

Projects.title: React Realtime Chat
desc: My ambitious project that delves into the world of interactive web development using React. This project is a realtime chat application that allows users to create chat rooms and chat with other users in realtime. The application is built using React, Firebase, and Daisy UI.

This project is my second react project and my first project using Firebase. I learned a lot about how to use Firebase and how to use React to create a realtime application. I also learned how to use Daisy UI, a CSS framework that is built on top of Tailwind CSS.

Projects.title: React Tools
desc: React Tools is a groundbreaking and user-friendly project that brings together a comprehensive collection of tools and components crafted with cutting-edge technologies, including React, React Router, and TailwindCSS. What sets this project apart is that it's not just a suite of powerful features, but it's also a significant milestone as it marks my very first venture into the world of React development.

Unlike traditional web applications, React Tools cleverly utilizes browser local storage, eliminating the need for external databases. This not only ensures seamless performance but also prioritizes user data privacy.

The Todo List keeps tasks in check with intuitive task management capabilities, ensuring you never miss a beat. The note-taking feature provides a hassle-free way to jot down ideas and crucial information, accessible whenever inspiration strikes. Additionally, our robust expense tracker simplifies financial management by recording and categorizing expenses, delivering insightful spending analysis.

Projects.title: Aleph Discord Bot
desc: Aleph is a Discord bot that I created for my dircord server to use. The bot is built using Python and the discord.py library. The bot has image grabber feauture that takes argument (keywords) and returns an image from the internet.

Other than that this bot has a few other features such as utility command to delete a messages, and a command to get the server's ping. This bot is still in development and I plan to add more features in the future.

Projects.title: LPTK Cup 2023 Website
desc: LPTK Cup UM is a website that I created for a competition held by  the Universitas Negeri Malang. The website is mainly built using Laravel and Bootstrap. The website has a few features such as a registration form, a login system, article system, file upload,  and a dashboard for the admin to manage the contents.

This project is my second freelance project, this project is not as big as my first freelance project but I learned a lot from this project. I learn how to manage a project and how to work with a team.

Projects.title: NU INO Website
desc: My first freelance project. This project is a website for a School based on a JALAKAR curriculum. The website is built mainly using Laravel and Bootstrap.
This website is LMS like system, have a user management, user auth, quiz and material for student and FAQ
In this project I learned how to work with a team and how to manage a project. I also learned new library such as livewire and alpine.js.
